jx.jx_en_mean: the right of a tenant of property to occupy it after the lease expires (unless a court should order otherwise)

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French, from tenir 'to hold', from Latin tenere

entry.tran: (房屋的)居住权;(土地的)使用权，使用期
entry.def: Tenure is the legal right to live in a particular building or to use a particular piece of land during a fixed period of time.

example.ex: Lack of security of tenure was a reason for many families becoming homeless.
example.tran: 居住权得不到保证是许多家庭居无定所的一个原因。

entry.def: Tenure is the period of time during which someone holds an important job.

example.ex: He was in the middle of his tenure as Oxford Professor of Poetry and at the height of his fame.
example.tran: 当时，他在牛津担任诗歌教授的聘期刚到一半，声誉正隆。

entry.def: If you have tenure in your job, you have the right to keep it until you retire.

example.ex: Junior staff have only a slim chance of getting tenure.
example.tran: 初级职员得到终身职位的机会十分渺茫。

means.word_mean: 1. the term during which some position is held
2. the right to hold property; part of an ancient hierarchical system of holding lands

sentences.sentence: "She was tenured after she published her book"

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. =hold,表示"拿住,握住,支撑"; 2. 挽留

stems_affixes.word_buile: con全部+ten拿住,握住,支撑+t→全部拿住→容量,内容;满足的
dis不+content满足的→n.不满,不满足 adj.不满的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 站得住脚的,无懈可击的
stems_affixes.word_buile: ten拿住,握住,支撑+able能……的→能拿住的
ten拿住,握住,支撑+acious多……的→拿住不放→固执的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 站不住脚的,防守不住的
stems_affixes.word_buile: un不+tenable[adj.站得住脚的,无懈可击的]→adj.站不住脚的,防守不住的
con全部+ten拿住,握住,支撑+t→全部拿住→容量,内容;满足的
coun=con+ten拿住,握住,支撑+ance表名词→全部控制→容忍,表示不提意见,同意
dis不+content满足的→n.不满,不满足 adj.不满的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 维修,保养,维持,保持,生活费用
stems_affixes.word_buile: main=man手+ten拿住,握住,支撑+ance表名词→用手拿住→维修,坚持
sus下面+ten支撑+ance表名词→支撑下去的东西→粮食;坚持
ten拿住,握住,支撑+acity表名词→tenacious名词

stems_affixes.value_cn: 租赁期限;租佃,租用,租赁
stems_affixes.word_buile: ten拿住,握住,支撑+ancy表名词→拿[钱]租房
ten拿住,握住,支撑+ant人→拿[钱]租房之人
ten拿住,握住,支撑+ure表名词→拿住状态
coun=con+ten拿住,握住,支撑+ance表名词→全部控制→容忍,表示不提意见,同意
fas+ten拿住,握住,支撑→v.[使]固定，系牢，绑紧，扣紧
ten拿住,握住,支撑+ant人→拿[钱]租房之人

Sentence.sentence: Instead of protecting speech and encouraging diversity and innovative thinking, the tenure system often stifles(压制)them: younger professors must win the approval of established colleagues for tenure, encouraging like-mindedness and sometimes inhibiting the free flow of ideas.

Whether they experiment with three-year degrees, offer year-round classes, challenge the tenure system—or all of the above—universities are slowly realizing that to stay competitive and relevant they must adapt to a rapidly changing world
The author thinks the tenure system in American universities .
